Defect.refObjectName: INGESTION: Some uses of IDREF are not supported
Defect.Description:
For example:
InterchangeEducationorganization/School/ClassPeriodReference and InterchangeEducationorganization/School/LocationReference are not currently supported by id-ref resolution.
While ingesting  InterchangeEducationorganization snippet files are generated for the ClassPeriodReference and LocationReference ids.

The handler needs to be optimized for such cases.
Defect.Name: INGESTION: Some uses of IDREF are not supported
Defect.ReleaseNoteDescription: InterchangeEducationorganization/School/ClassPeriodReference and InterchangeEducationorganization/School/LocationReference among others are currently not supported by IDREF resolution.

Defect.refObjectName: INGESTION: School and EdOrg only supports a single representation of parentEducationAgencyReference
Defect.Description:
Ingestion of School and EdOrg only supports a single representation of Ed-Fi parentEducationAgencyReference

Alternate representations of parentEducationAgencyReference are not being resolved.

This not just confined to this relationship.  However, the fix is not global but rather on a entity per entity basis
Defect.Name: INGESTION: School and EdOrg only supports a single representation of parentEducationAgencyReference
Defect.ReleaseNoteDescription: Reference resolution is only supported as the default scenario that features no exceptional or error conditions. As such a user may ingest valid EdFi format with improper references that would fail to resolve.

Defect.refObjectName: INGESTION: Global uniqueness of ProgramIdentifier is assumed when multiple EdOrgs can use the same IDs
Defect.Description:
Old name: 
[Need Ed-Fi clarification] Error found in US1876: Ingestion engine changes in support for Program: ProgramIdentifier required to be unique
The current implementation of program ingestion requires that the programIdentifiers must be unique across the tenant, however, in EdFi, the programIdentifiers are required to be unique within an EdOrg. 

The reference resolution for programs is not guaranteed to work correctly if there are multiple programs in different EdOrgs in the same tenant with the same programIdentifier.
Defect.Name: INGESTION: Global uniqueness of ProgramIdentifier is assumed when multiple EdOrgs can use the same IDs

Defect.refObjectName: [Need Ed-Fi clarification] Change ingestion to allow Program's ProgramId to be scoped to an EdOrg rather than a tenant.

Requirement.refObjectName: Ingestion engine changes in support for Program

Defect.ReleaseNoteDescription: Ingestion process assumes that the Program ID is unique within a tenant, this should really be unique within the specified EdOrg. The potential is that the reference could resolve incorrectly.

Defect.refObjectName: INGESTION: DisciplineDescriptor not currently supported in Interchange-StudentDiscipline
Defect.Description: Explicitly listed as not supported but DisciplineAction entity requires a reference to this Descriptor.
Defect.Name: INGESTION: DisciplineDescriptor not currently supported in Interchange-StudentDiscipline
Defect.ReleaseNoteDescription: Entity not being ingested but a reference to it may exist in another entity.

Defect.refObjectName: INGESTION: EducationOrganization references to Program not properly ingested
Defect.Description:
SLI XSD educationOrganization has programReference as a string; it should be a reference

This defect prevents program references inside of EdOrg from being resolved.

Priority would be defined by determining the important of this relationship.

Resolution for this would require changing the SLI xsd.
Defect.Name: INGESTION: EducationOrganization references to Program not properly ingested
Defect.ReleaseNoteDescription: This is a reference which hasn't been implemented, the effect is that the API won't provide a link from the EdOrg to the Program.

Defect.refObjectName: SDK: Java client API library requires a SLIClient instance per user
Defect.Description:
The java client api is caching the SessionToken for the authenticated user.  To support a multi-user environment, this requires a instance of the SLIClient per authenticated user.  

Propose the following changes:
- Update the SLIClient.Connect call to return the session token to the caller.
- Update the remaining SLIClient methods to require the session token.
- Update the documentation to reflect that the caller needs to retain the token and pass it in to all future calls.
- Rework current implementation which tracks sessions
Defect.Name: SDK: Java client API library requires a SLIClient instance per user

Requirement.refObjectName: Improvements to the Java Client Library

Defect.ReleaseNoteDescription:
The client library does not support multiple sessions.  If used in a multi session environment as is, then users can have conflicting actions eg. update the same resource at the same time. 

Workaround:
Create an instance of SLIClient for each connection to the API, then attach the SLIClient to the HttpSession.  Sample code for this is available in the AuthFiter.java class for the Sample application.

Defect.refObjectName: DASHBOARD: Enrollment History - Teacher cannot see the names of past schools their students attended
Defect.Description:
Repro Steps:
- Log in as Linda Kim
- Click on Matts Sollar
- Look at his Enrollment History
- We cannot see that he attended South Daybreak Elementary in gr4

Bug Description:
- In enrollment history, teacher cannot see the name of the school that his student attended if the teacher doesn't have access to that school.

- Copy from Sravan's email from 4/19:
             When a teacher tries to look at a student’s enrollment history, we can get access to the studentSchoolAssociations from the api for the teacher. The associations however only contain the id of the school the student is associated with. To display the name of the school, we have to make a call to the /schools service. The problem arises when a student has attended a school in the past, which the teacher does not have access to. In this case, making a call to the /schools service returns a 403 Forbidden error. A quick fix would be to add the name of the school to the studentSchoolAssociations and possibly some other relevant values.
Defect.Name: DASHBOARD: Enrollment History - Teacher cannot see the names of past schools their students attended
Defect.ReleaseNoteDescription: In Dashboard's Enrollment History panel, teachers cannot see the names of past schools a student attended, even when they are in the same district. The dates of enrollment and other data do appear, but school name is blank.

Defect.refObjectName: DASHBOARD: Student column in list of students suggests that it's sorted when first loaded
Defect.Description:
Repo Steps:
Go to Dashboard Login Page
Log in as linda.kim
Choose 8th Grade English - Section 6 on SDS data

Description:
When the LOS is loaded for the first time, the UI suggests that the student column is already sorted (the top triangle is grey-ed - suggesting that column is ascending sorted), however the column is not sorted.

It'll be better if the column is sorted based on what the UI suggests, else don't show the little triangle for Student.

Can we sort the Student column?
Defect.Name: DASHBOARD: Student column in list of students suggests that it's sorted when first loaded
Defect.ReleaseNoteDescription: Lists of students suggest that they are sorted alphabetically on load, however they are not. Pressing the normal sort button in the header works around this issue.

Defect.refObjectName: INGESTION: Course name (not course code) is used to uniquely identify and refer to Course entities
Defect.Description:
The unique identifier for a Course in ingestion is CourseTitle.  It should be CourseCode.

To be more precise, each CourseCode (can be many per Course) should be unique within the designated EdOrg, and each CourseCode should be able to identify the Course in isolation.

This situation could arise, for example, if a course was offered by both the Math department and Computer Science department of a school.  It's the same course, but each department would have their own course code.

Notes:
1. This defect is tracking the logic used to match an ingesting Course entity to one in the database.  Reference resolution for other types of entities to Course is is tracked by DE608.
2. The "schoolId" resolution from educationOrganizationReference is hardcoded to Course/EducationOrganizationReference/EducationalOrgIdentity/EducationOrgIdentificationCode/ID as it has been (and is expected by SDS data at the moment).  Hardcoding this reference is common throughout entities as there is no generic infrastructure to resolve the reference properly.  This has been raised and Peter is in dicussion to create tech debt for tracking.
Defect.Name: INGESTION: Course name (not course code) is used to uniquely identify and refer to Course entities
Defect.Notes:
2012-06-20— adjusted to p3. not critical to get into Alpha in 4.7. will function as designed with minor errors, so this will be moved to 5.1

Initial fix for this was rendered obsolete by Hermod changes.  Waiting to hear if fix has been done on new code. 
 
pbackes - Hermod says reimplement.

Task.refObjectName: Move Course to the the new ingestion pipeline

Defect.ReleaseNoteDescription: Course entities are uniquely identified by course name within an education organization, rather than by course code.

Defect.refObjectName: INGESTION: Section, school and session references in AttendanceEvent are ignored
Defect.Description:
The transformation for attendance ignores references in the inbound Ed-Fi Interchange-StudentAttendance files including:
 
- AttendanceEvent/SectionReference
- AttendanceEvent/SchoolReference
- AttendanceEvent/SessionReference
 
Instead, transformation logic queries SLI for School and Session information for a student and transforms and persists attendance according to the query results.
 
Additionally, the code treats the condition where a student is associated with two schools as an error condition.
 
In the submitter's opinion, the way attendance is handled by this transformer is not what a customer would expect (ignoring explicit characterization of the attendance event - by school, section, session etc. - contained in the data).
 
It also seems like a questionable assumption that a student would not be attending two (or more) schools at the same time.  Attending a high school and vocational school is not uncommon, for one example.
Defect.Name: INGESTION: Section, school and session references in AttendanceEvent are ignored
Defect.Notes: pbackes - I spoke with Ilya Bagrak regarding prioritization of this defect.  He believes this needs to wait until post-Alpha.
Defect.ReleaseNoteDescription: The way AttendanceEvent entities are handled ignores explicit characterization of the attendance event - by school, section, session, so AttendanceEvents for students attending multiple schools will not properly persisted.

Defect.refObjectName: INGESTION: Some fields of LocalEducationAgency are not persisted
Defect.Description:
LocalEducationAgency entity and related elements have been removed from the SLI schema including:
 
- LEACategory (THIS ELEMENT IS REQUIRED PER ED-FI)
- CharterStatus
- LocalEducationAgencyReference
- EducationServiceCenterReference
 
The entity and related elements need to be restored or mappings to equivalent targets provided.
Defect.Name: INGESTION: Some fields of LocalEducationAgency are not persisted
Defect.Notes:
MarkP:
I do not believe this causes actual system failure.  Moving to to SEV2 and Alpha.X target for now.

Please fill in this description with how this will actually cause the system to fall over and not be operational and I'm happy to renegotiate

[Pete Wenzel] Support for LocalEducationAgencyReference (subdistricts) needs to be escalated to P2, must-have for Alpha.1 (preferably earlier).  NYSED EdOrg, as provided to you on 05/15/2012, requires it.  e.g. NYC Community School Districts report to NYC CHANCELLOR'S OFFICE, all of which are LEAs.  Best to open a new DE just for LEARef?
Defect.ReleaseNoteDescription: LEACategory, CharterStatus, LocalEducationAgencyReference, EducationServiceCenterReference fields of LocalEducationAgency entities are currently ignored.

Defect.refObjectName: API: Field validation enumerations are not quoted correctly in API responses
Defect.Description:
When POST/PUT to the API and validation fails on an enumerated field, the values should be (single-)quoted in the error response. This removes ambiguity when commas appear in the values. It would be impossible to determine value enumeration values from a parsing perspective.

"Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources" and "Transportation, Distribution and Logistics" are valid enum values, but it's not obvious below:

{
    "type": "Bad Request",
    "message": "Validation failed: ValidationError [type=ENUMERATION_MISMATCH, fieldName=academicSubject, fieldValue=Agriculture, expectedTypes=[Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources, Architecture and Construction, Business and Marketing, Communication and Audio/Visual Technology, Composite, Computer and Information Sciences, Critical Reading, ELA, Engineering and Technology, English, English Language and Literature, Fine and Performing Arts, Foreign Language and Literature, Health Care Sciences, Hospitality and Tourism, Human Services, Life and Physical Sciences, Manufacturing, Mathematics, Military Science, Miscellaneous, Other, Physical, Health, and Safety Education, Public, Protective, and Government Service, Reading, Religious Education and Theology, Science, Social Sciences and History, Social Studies, Transportation, Distribution and Logistics, Writing]]",
    "code": 400
}
Defect.Name: API: Field validation enumerations are not quoted correctly in API responses
Defect.ReleaseNoteDescription: Some fields contain enumerated values with commas even though they are single values. For example, the course.academicSubject field contains this single enumeration: "Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources." This appears to be three distinct enumerated values in a validation error message.

Defect.refObjectName: DATA BROWSER: No error is displayed when user traverses data they are not authorized to access
Defect.Description: When navigating in the databrowser if I try to access a link from within a table entry to get entities that I don't have context to I don't get an error. Just get redirected back to the list page I was on. Can be confusing to a user because you don't know why you didn't get what you wanted.
Defect.Name: DATA BROWSER: No error is displayed when user traverses data they are not authorized to access
Defect.ReleaseNoteDescription: The Data Browser does not inform the user why there is no result (nothing is returned) when a user tries to navigate (click on URL) to data that he/she has no permissions to access.

Defect.refObjectName: DATA BROWSER: No notification message is displayed when accessing an empty list
Defect.Description: If you request a list of entities that is empty the databrowser does nothing. It should at least tell you the list was empty.
Defect.Name: DATA BROWSER: No notification message is displayed when accessing an empty list
Defect.ReleaseNoteDescription: If a user click a URL that returns an empty list, there is no message that states that. The user might get an impression that the URL is incorrect.

Defect.refObjectName: DATA BROWSER: Incorrect user name is displayed after re-login with different user (after session have expired)
Defect.Description:
Login as linda.kim to data browser
Let your session expire (5 minutes, but not longer or else the rails session will expire too)
Click on a link the data browser
Login as rrogers
Notice that the banner still says linda.kim
Defect.Name: DATA BROWSER: Incorrect user name is displayed after re-login with different user (after session have expired)
Defect.ReleaseNoteDescription:
If the user tries to re-log in in the Data Browser with a different user, after the session of the prior user was expired, the top right corner of the Data Browser will still show the old user's name. 

Workaround: Users can close and relaunch the browser to see correct name displayed.

Defect.refObjectName: ADMIN TOOLS: Admin app not handling API session timeout
Defect.Description:
<scole 6/18> Actual problem is that the API session times out and the admin app doesn't handle it for javascript calls.

- In sandbox mode, came in to the application registration page with one application present.
- Added a second application.
- Deleted the newly created application.
- Saw no change on screen - both applications still listed.
- Reloaded page, only see the expected one application.
Defect.Name: ADMIN TOOLS: Admin app not handling API session timeout
Defect.Notes:
Removed "MH Alpha.0" tag and setting "Release Note" == TRUE, as the workaround is to do a page refresh.  Should be addressed with a Release Note.

-m-
Defect.ReleaseNoteDescription: In some cases, when the user tries to remove an application in the Application Registration Tool, the application is removed from the system, but it still appears in the application list. The user should refresh the page, so the application is removed from the list.

Defect.refObjectName: INGESTION: Irregular error logging when same data set is ingested multiple times
Defect.Description:
When ingesting the StoriedDataSet_IL_Daybreak dataset numerous times on both a local PC and devgalactus, an error file was created during one of the runs on each platform (first run for PC and third run for devgalactus).
The error file involved the file InterchangeEducationOrgCalendar.xml, and the message was: "ERROR  Failed to process [session] due to preceding errors."  Each time the error file was produced, the job file contained the line: "INFO  Not all records were processed completely due to errors." instead of the message "INFO  All records processed successfully." displayed when the error file was not created.  The number of records reported as considered, ingested successfully and failed was identical for both machines over all the runs, as were the number of records persisted to the database.  Warning files were produced consistently over each ingestion, and appear to be identical between the two platforms.
Defect.Name: INGESTION: Irregular error logging when same data set is ingested multiple times
Defect.Notes: Been fixed by the lastest alpha.0
Defect.ReleaseNoteDescription: Occasionally Ingestion gives error report when there is no error.

Defect.refObjectName: INGESTION: Duplicates should be reported
Defect.Description: While ingesting SDS IL-DAYBREAK, out of 325 studentSectionAssociation records only 297 were persisted to mongo db because of duplicates. At the end of the job processing a warning message should be reported for the duplicate records that were not persisted.
Defect.Name: INGESTION: Duplicates should be reported
Defect.ReleaseNoteDescription: Error reports are not always clear regarding the records persisted. When there are duplicates within the XML file, or a record already exists, ingestion engine will update the record, but this record count is not included in the Ingested records count.

Defect.refObjectName: INGESTION: Processed files are left in a hidden directory
Defect.Description:
Numerous times we've found the ingestion installations on the CI environment are leaving files in their ingestion landing zone folder lz/inbound/.done/.

If these files are not cleaned up, they will eventually grow to run the server out of disk space.  The ingestion process should clean up the files after it has completed ingesting the data.
Defect.Name: INGESTION: Processed files are left in a hidden directory
Defect.Notes:
Checked with Justin and Igor. The current scope of this defect is to clean out the files related to current batch job from the unzip folder.

Files are being removed where applicable. In cases where we can't remove files (ie corrupt control file) We provide error msg for the user that due to the control file problem, they will need to manually clean up their LZ.
Defect.ReleaseNoteDescription:
Ingestion process leaves files in ingestion landing zone folder lz/inbound/.done 

Workaround: Manually delete files in .done folder

Defect.refObjectName: INGESTION: large ingestion in one tenant may delay visibility of new data in another tenant.
Defect.Description:
formerly known as: "SLI security context tagging should be more efficient"
forderly known as: "SLI Should not have a Staff EdOrg Stamper (i.e. DE646 is not done)"

I am not going to open up DE646, but I believe that the EdOrg stamper side of the solution could be a mistake.  Why can't the code do the EdOrg stamping when rows are inserted into the DAL (even if it does it asynchronously), either through Ingestion or through the API.

I am logging this as Sev2 because I believe that is how our customers will see it when their data doesn't come into the system in any predictable length of time.

Dwayne, if this is you, please feel free to come talk to me.  If somebody else is the right person, then assign it to that person and have them come talk to me.
Defect.Name: INGESTION: large ingestion in one tenant may delay visibility of new data in another tenant.
Defect.ReleaseNoteDescription: New data that is ingested or created through the API needs to be tagged before it will be visible to users.  The time taken to tag new data is dependent upon how large the dataset is, how much of the data is new, and the state of the tagger when the new data is created.  The tagging process runs across all tenants, implying that a large ingestion in one tenant may delay visibility of new data in not only that tenant, but in others as well.

Defect.refObjectName: INGESTION: Super Admins should not be capable of ingesting EdOrgs above their own EdOrg
Defect.Description:
Super Admins should not be capable of ingesting EdOrgs above their own EdOrg.  Example:
 
- An LEA (District) Super Admin should not be able to ingest the SEA above them.
 
[JW]  They are then able to ingest sibling LEAs, State Staff, etc



Security risk is medium-low.  Low impact.  Medium probability.
Defect.Name: INGESTION: Super Admins should not be capable of ingesting EdOrgs above their own EdOrg

Requirement.refObjectName: I want LZs to be restricted by EdOrg as well as tenant.

Defect.ReleaseNoteDescription: During ingestion process the landing zone is tolerant of any EdOrg within a tenant being ingested. For example, two LEAs belong to the same SEA. LEA #1 can ingest data for LEA #2 since they are both part of SEA. LEA #1 can also ingest data for SEA. This is not ideal since there is not restriction to data specific to each LEA, but it is functional and ingestion works properly.

Defect.refObjectName: INGESTION: References to Course by other entities do not use CourseCode
Defect.Description:
DE162 addresses how an incoming Course entity will match to one in the db.
However, the way other entities such as CourseOffering reference Course needs to also use CourseCode and EdOrd to identify the Course they are referencing.

From the EdFi CourseIdentity xsd documentation:
Provide user information to lookup and link to an existing course record in the receiving system.  Two cases are supported:
1. StateCourseCode or other standard course code
2. SchoolOrganizationID + LocalCourseCode

Course currently continues to set its externalId to courseTitle since CourseOffering and StudentTranscript currently depend on it.  Course should be updated to have externalId removed as part of this defect fix since it should no longer be necessary.
Defect.Name: INGESTION: References to Course by other entities do not use CourseCode
Defect.Notes:
(course)body.courseCode should be mapped to (referencing entity)body.CourseReference.CourseIdentity.CourseCode.  However, courseCode and CourseCode are both lists of complex objects.

After conversation with various people (David Holmes, Peter Backes, an EdFi contact), we have identified the following as the correct way to resolve this reference:
The way this particular reference resolution must work is as an OR list.  Essentially, all the CourseCodes (which are complex objects) must be ORed together, and should return exactly one Course.  If it returns more than one, that's an error.  Essentially, there should be exactly one Course in the DB that has one or more (but not necessarily all) of the CourseCodes listed in the reference (nor do all the CourseCodes in the Course need to be represented in the reference).
You do not necessarily have to do this through ID Normalizer.  This is the first time we've hit a reference resolution that goes this way.  If we do not expect to resolve anything other than Course via an OR list, then we should probably use the entity-specific class (IE, FooEdFi2SLITransformer).

Task.refObjectName: Create Edfi2XLI transformer for entities that have course references
[Tech Debt]: Update Course Resolution for CourseOffering post DE87

Defect.ReleaseNoteDescription: Entities referencing Course use CourseTitle (not CourseCode and EdOrg as specified by Ed-Fi) to uniquely identify a Course entity. Users will see inconsistencies with local descriptions of Courses until the entity is properly handled.

Defect.refObjectName: INGESTION: CourseOffering is ingested in a way that deviates from Ed-Fi
Defect.Description:
Ed-Fi does not have a direct relationship between Session and Section, but stuffs CourseOffering in the middle.

We've added a direct reference to Session in the SLI Section entity, which also contains a direct reference to a Course and another to a School.

So we have all the connections that are handled by an Ed-Fi CourseOffering. 

The only thing missing is LocalCourseCode and LocalCourseTitle.  Those are only relevant if a school wants to recode/rename a Course defined by a district, for example.  

Given all the changes it would imply to the existing entity relationships, we're probably looking at 5-8 points to address this defect.

First thing to do: Decide how serious this is and re-classify if necessary.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Correcting/adding to the above statements:
 
- The sessionCourseAssociation entity in the SLI data model (the equivalent to Ed-Fi’s CourseOffering) that *IS* being populated.  It is being populated during Section ingestion via CourseOfferingReference.
- What that means is that during ingestion we ingest references to CourseOfferings in Section without the corresponding CourseOffering entities themselves which will be confusing to our customers to say the very least.
- The adding of a separate Course reference to Section is also a defect (DE87) – Ed-Fi establishes a relationship between Sessions and Courses via CourseOffering which is then referenced by Section.  Breaking these references apart as has been done in SLI will no longer guarantee valid pairings of Session and Course (aka a CourseOffering) for a Section.
___________________________________________________________________
 
The CourseOffering entity is not being ingested but is required both in terms of published specifications for SLI and to support a cohesive SLI data model.
 
According to the SLI Deviations page, the sessionCourseAssociation entity "associates course entities with the sessions they are offered; includes the attributes from the CourseOffering Ed-Fi entity" and is essentially the Ed-Fi CourseOffering entity under a different name.  Recommend reverting to original name to avoid confusion.
 
Additionally, the Ed-Fi mandatory element SchoolReference has been removed from the SLI schema for this entity.  Recommend restoring the element or providing mapping rules to resolve.
 
INGESTION SUPPORT AND THE RESTORATION OF SchoolReference MUST BE ADDRESSED.
Defect.Name: INGESTION: CourseOffering is ingested in a way that deviates from Ed-Fi
Defect.ReleaseNoteDescription: The CourseOffering entity is ingested in a way that deviates from the Ed-Fi definition. Users may see inconsistencies with local descriptions of courses.

Defect.refObjectName: INGESTION: Section entity is ingested in a way that deviates from Ed-Fi
Defect.Description:
The section entity in the SLI schema has been restructured relative to Ed-Fi as follows:
 
- CourseOfferingReference has been removed and replaced with a reference to Course.  Course and CourseOffering are not equivalent.  Recommend reversion of change or that detailed mapping rules be provided.
- sessionId (AKA SessionReference in Ed-Fi) has been made mandatory while it is an optional element in Ed-Fi.  Recommend reversion or extension to customer facing Ed-Fi.
- Optional elements LocationReference and ClassPeriodReference have been removed.  Location and ClassPeriod are out of scope for Alpha so a core schema extension should be used to drop these attributes.  This will be handled in a different story/defect TBD.
 
SUBSTITUTION OF Course FOR CourseOfferingReference MUST BE ADDRESSED.
Defect.Name: INGESTION: Section entity is ingested in a way that deviates from Ed-Fi
Defect.Notes:
Working this and DE85 together.  Tasks:
* Rename sessionCourceAssociation to CourseOffering, resolving deviation from EdFi.
* ingest all fields in CourseOffering, including schoolReference
* Change section->course to section->courseOffering
* section->session becomes optional, resolving deviation from EdFi

Task.refObjectName: ingest all fields in CourseOffering, including schoolReference
Change section->course to section->courseOffering, resolving deviation from EdFi
section->session becomes optional, resolving deviation from EdFi
Rename sessionCourceAssociation to CourseOffering, resolving deviation from EdFi.
Fix section courseOffering resolution in section
Fix ingestion acceptance tests to use courseOffering

Defect.ReleaseNoteDescription: The Section entity deviates from the Ed-Fi definition and is related to a defect where CourseOffering is not handled properly. Users may see inconsistencies with local descriptions of courses and sections until the CourseOffering defect is resolved.

Defect.refObjectName: API: Duplicate links in certain types of resource responses.
Defect.Description:
Requesting a student resource results in several duplicate links, some apparently invalid:
{
        "rel": "getStudentProgramAssociations",
        "href": "https://nxslave09.slidev.org/api/rest/v1/students/c3f98dda-7dd1-4988-9eed-5ca5f0468ed4/studentProgramAssociations"
    }
and right below it
{
        "rel": "getStudentProgramAssociations",
        "href": "https://nxslave09.slidev.org/api/rest/v1/studentProgramAssociations?studentId=c3f98dda-7dd1-4988-9eed-5ca5f0468ed4"
    }
also 
{
        "rel": "getCourseTranscripts",
        "href": "https://nxslave09.slidev.org/api/rest/v1/students/c3f98dda-7dd1-4988-9eed-5ca5f0468ed4/courseTranscripts"
    }
and 
{
        "rel": "getCourseTranscripts",
        "href": "https://nxslave09.slidev.org/api/rest/v1/courseTranscripts?studentId=c3f98dda-7dd1-4988-9eed-5ca5f0468ed4"
    }
Defect.Name: API: Duplicate links in certain types of resource responses.
Defect.Notes: The links all look valid in the description, but it's certainly odd that we have multiple links with the same relationship name (and that return the same payload).
Defect.ReleaseNoteDescription: In the response bodies of certain resources, links with identical names and results may appear. However, both forms of the duplicated URIs resolve correctly.

Defect.refObjectName: INGESTION: Ingestion job will begin processing a new job even though previous job has not yet completed
Defect.Description:
Ingestion service can start processing a zip file (or batch) while processing of the current batch have not completed. That resulted in errors.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Drop a medium size dataset
2. Confirm the it disappeared from the lz directory
3. What few moments
4. Drop a purge.zip to clean your tenant's collections
5. The first batch fails and produces an error file.
Defect.Name: INGESTION: Ingestion job will begin processing a new job even though previous job has not yet completed
Defect.Notes: Edge case, if immediately after data load if a purge operation is executed we have race conditions. Work around is not purging immediately after data load.
Defect.ReleaseNoteDescription: Ingestion job will begin processing a new job even though previous job has not yet completed. Workaround: verify that a job is completed prior to uploading another job

Defect.refObjectName: INGESTION: Session entity Grading Period reference not fully supported
Defect.Description:
Session entity Grading Period Reference is not fully supported - does not support EducationOrganizationIdentificationCode.

Supported:

        <GradingPeriod id="GP_1">
        <GradingPeriodIdentity>
          <GradingPeriod>First Six Weeks</GradingPeriod>
          <SchoolYear>2011-2012</SchoolYear>
          <StateOrganizationId>Charlie School</StateOrganizationId>
        </GradingPeriodIdentity>
                <BeginDate>2010-09-01</BeginDate>
                <EndDate>2010-12-01</EndDate>
                <TotalInstructionalDays>90</TotalInstructionalDays>
                <CalendarDateReference ref="CD_1"/>
        </GradingPeriod>

Unsupported:

<GradingPeriod id="GP_2">
      <GradingPeriodIdentity>
             <GradingPeriod>First Six Weeks</GradingPeriod>
             <SchoolYear>2011-2012</SchoolYear>
             <EducationOrgIdentificationCode IdentificationSystem="School">
                   <ID>Charlie School</ID>
             </EducationOrgIdentificationCode>
        </GradingPeriodIdentity>
         <BeginDate>2011-01-01</BeginDate>
          <EndDate>2011-04-01</EndDate>
          <TotalInstructionalDays>90</TotalInstructionalDays>
           <CalendarDateReference ref="CD_2"/>
 </GradingPeriod>
Defect.Name: INGESTION: Session entity Grading Period reference not fully supported
Defect.ReleaseNoteDescription:
EducationOrganizationIdentificationCode is not supported as a form of reference. 

Workaround: Use StateOrganizationId as the reference inside GradingPeriodIdentity.

Defect.refObjectName: INGESTION: Not all .tmp files deleted from the user's landing zone after processing is complete
Defect.Description: Will try to reproduce and add details here.
Defect.Name: INGESTION: Not all .tmp files deleted from the user's landing zone after processing is complete
Defect.ReleaseNoteDescription: Workaround: users can delete the files manually.

Defect.refObjectName: SDK: Sample application should handle lack of access more elegantly than an ISE 500
Defect.Description:
In the cross app tests, when the slcoperator removes access to the sample application it fails harshly with an ISE 500:  

HTTP ERROR: 500

INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR

RequestURI=/sample/callback

Caused by:

java.lang.NullPointerException
      at org.slc.sli.api.client.impl.RESTClient.connect(RESTClient.java:107)
      at org.slc.sli.api.client.impl.BasicClient.connect(BasicClient.java:55)
      at org.slc.sli.sample.oauth.AuthFilter.handleCallback(AuthFilter.java:75)
      at org.slc.sli.sample.oauth.AuthFilter.doFilter(AuthFilter.java:50)
      at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.ServletHandler$CachedChain.doFilter(ServletHandler.java:1084)
      at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.ServletHandler.handle(ServletHandler.java:360)
      at org.mortbay.jetty.security.SecurityHandler.handle(SecurityHandler.java:216)
      at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.SessionHandler.handle(SessionHandler.java:181)
      at org.mortbay.jetty.handler.ContextHandler.handle(ContextHandler.java:726)
      at org.mortbay.jetty.webapp.WebAppContext.handle(WebAppContext.java:405)
      at org.mortbay.jetty.handler.ContextHandlerCollection.handle(ContextHandlerCollection.java:206)
      at org.mortbay.jetty.handler.HandlerCollection.handle(HandlerCollection.java:114)
      at org.mortbay.jetty.handler.HandlerWrapper.handle(HandlerWrapper.java:152)
      at org.mortbay.jetty.Server.handle(Server.java:324)
      at org.mortbay.jetty.HttpConnection.handleRequest(HttpConnection.java:505)
      at org.mortbay.jetty.HttpConnection$RequestHandler.content(HttpConnection.java:843)
      at org.mortbay.jetty.HttpParser.parseNext(HttpParser.java:648)
      at org.mortbay.jetty.HttpParser.parseAvailable(HttpParser.java:211)
      at org.mortbay.jetty.HttpConnection.handle(HttpConnection.java:380)
      at org.mortbay.io.nio.SelectChannelEndPoint.run(SelectChannelEndPoint.java:395)
      at org.mortbay.thread.QueuedThreadPool$PoolThread.run(QueuedThreadPool.java:488)

Powered by Jetty://
Defect.Name: SDK: Sample application should handle lack of access more elegantly than an ISE 500

Task.refObjectName: Verify fixes made on the tenant-id-queries branch

Defect.ReleaseNoteDescription: This error occurs when the authenticated user doesn't have any contextual data or does not have rights to access the application. Workaround: Identify a user in the dataset ingested that has contextual data associated. Eg. a teacher with sections and students. SLC Operator has to enable the application for the user's Educational Organization.

Defect.refObjectName: PORTAL: When a user reports a problem via portal no email is sent to SLC
Defect.Description: Report a problem form does not send emails in prod.
Defect.Name: PORTAL: When a user reports a problem via portal no email is sent to SLC
Defect.ReleaseNoteDescription: Currently, using report a problem form in the portal does not send a problem report to SLC. Workaround: manually report a problem by sending email to issues@dev.slcedu.org
